main.name: Andile Jaden Mbele
main.description: First and foremost I am a problem solver. I am a self-starter and a self-driven software engineer. I hope to some day build my own start-up to solve some of Africa's and World's most pertinent problems spanning healthcare, food security, energy distribution, finance and social inequality.
main.bio: Programmer | Software Engineer | Geek | Ambivert | Researcher | Non-Linear Thinker | Health & Fitness Fanatic | I love engineering, code and rockets.
main.contactMessage: Hello there, please feel to get in touch.

resume.skillMessage: In my 4 years of experience I have used many tools depending on the problem at hand. I have varying degrees of experience with different technologies and stacks.

education.description: My 4 years of College were one of my best years in both in terms of growth and exposure. My college classes comprised of Software Engineering, Data Structures and Algorithms, Databases, Data Communication, Networks, Mathematics & Statistics, Computer Quantitative Methods, Object Oriented Programming, Cybersecurity & Ethics and Project Management

education.degree: Introduction to Computer Science and Programming
education.description: This remains the highlight of my career in software development. I met numerous individuals who are doing great things and whom we have remained in touch and collaborating on multiple projects.The curriculum comprised of Computer program Interpretation, Structured Types of Data, Dynamic Programming, Algorithmic Complexity, Algorithmic  Thinking, Higher Order Functions, Recursive Programming and Object Oriented Programming

testimonials.feedback: You wrote good code on the Dabane project üî•üëçüèª Good come back there

A piece of code you wrote when you were defining the Place schema helped me solve a very big problem I was encountering when I was doing my project. So thanks mate. You helped me a ton. I hope you see just how awesome and talented you are at the stuff you do. Never forget that.

work.title: Data Engineer
work.description: I am tasked with building pipelines for parsing data, 38+ Billion records from open source databases, combo lists, scraped data, marketing lists, transaction data, etc I program scripts to clean and analyze billions of records to create Personal Identifiable Data (PID) datasets. I further optimize development by building automation scripts for several processes including SQL and CSV parsing. I have streamlined development and data analysis to achieve the most effective and efficient workflow.

work.title: Founder & CEO
work.description: It has always been my dream to start my own company. For a very long time I have been procrastinating on doing so, until now. I recently pitched a product we are building to investors and we have secured a funding round. I am currently working on the product's development, and possibly have a beta version of the product ready for public testing before year end.

work.title: Fullstack Software Developer
work.description: I was brought on board as a fullstack developer to work on the extension of a Django Rest API for one of Zimbabwe's biggest medical AID companies, MASCA. I applied my expertise in the development of the four frontend applications for MASCA. My day-to-day tasks involved writing code for the several applications in development, I also wrote documentation and application architecture.

work.title: Lead Software Developer
work.description: I started off as a software engineering intern and I was promoted to Lead Software Developer after 9 months for having proved myself as reliable, dependable and skilled. I led a team of three developers tasked with various application development. We worked with several tools and technology stacks encompassing JavaScript, React, Postman, Dialogflow, Nodejs to name just a few.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: After completing the 6 week coding boot camp with Emzini We Code, I proved myself as a skillful programmer and therefore I was recruited as a Teaching Assistant where I work alongside some of the smartest people in my cohort who study in big name schools such as Stanford University, Northwestern University, Bryn Mawr University, MIT and Alabama State University.
